intro: Rubus ulmifolius f. rusticus, commonly known as the rough-bracted blackberry, is a variant of the common blackberry. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Botanically, it is noted for its hairy stems and leaves, which distinguish it from other Rubus species.
